alert.note: Alert for Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 8:10PM EST until January 03 at 11:52PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Ohio, including the following county, Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM EST, Local law enforcement reported minor flooding on the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, Greenup, South Webster, Sciotodale, Franklin Furnace, Lyra, Powellsville, Sciotoville, Haverhill, Firebrick and Saint Paul.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
